description: Composite n whose product of divisors divided by number of divisors is integral.
comments: Sequence is identical to A120736 except that it does not include terms 1 and 2 that are not composite. _Michel Marcus_, Jun 06 2014
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000
example: a(2)=8; for n=8 product of divisors is 8*4*2*1=64; 64/4, number of divisors, = 16.
prog: (PARI) isok(n) = (n!=1) && ! isprime(n) && (d = divisors(n)) && ((prod(i=1, #d, d[i]) % numdiv(n)) == 0); \\ _Michel Marcus_, Jun 05 2014(PARI) is(n)=my(f=factor(n)); n>5 && !isprime(n) && if(gcd(f[,2])%2, n^(numdiv(f)/2), sqrtint(n)^numdiv(f))%numdiv(f)==0 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, Jun 06 2014
author: _Enoch Haga_, Dec 11 1999
